website_summaries.verdict: Its feature set is basic even by entry-level standards, but the Nikon D3000 delivers the photo quality and performance you expect when stepping up to a dSLR, with an optional interface that's very beginner friendly.
pros: nicely laid out interactive control panel
solid photo quality up through ISO 1,600

customer_reviews.title: The Greatest Basic DSLR Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a great start for those who want to move to DSLR from your regular point-and-shoot cameras, like Coolpix. This doesn't have overwhelming bells and whistles like the other 4-number series or the 2-number series. This gets you used to the basics of DSLR's...like how to change a lens, lens care, body care, focal points, using a top wheel, using a thumb wheel, and answers your basic "What does THAT button do" questions. If you're interested in going DSLR, and want to start slow, I advise the 3000. Graduating from this will make it SO much easier when you get the camera you really want.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good condition!
customer_reviews.text: The camera came in in great condition! I was worried since it is a used camera, but there isn’t anything wrong with it it seems. I am very very happy with this! It also came with everything that the company listed it had and was packaged very securely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken camera
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this for my daughter and we just opened it. The front of the camera where it says Nikon is cracked and missing. When purchasing this camera none of the pictures showed a crack. Also on one side of the camera there is a bunch of black stained dots. Almost if they sprayed it and then didn’t wipe it, now they are stained. Super disappointed that the quality of the camera is not what was pictured in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as an upgrade from my point and shoot to a) take better pictures and 2) actually learn how to take pictures. It is well priced so that it's not a huge investment. If I realized that I have no real interest in becoming a better photographer then I can at least take better pictures. If after my intro photography classes, I decided to pursue it as a long term hobby then I'll probably upgrade again...but I'm pretty sure that won't happen for awhile. I thought not having a liveview would bother me...it really doesn't make a difference to me. Overall, I'd recommend it to my "I have a budding interest in photography" friends.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for a nephew and I know he is going to be extremely happy with this camera. Beware of other websites that offer them at more discounted pricing because something they do not tell you is that everything cost you extra. I had originally purchased from another site and then they wanted to charge me for a battery (which comes with the camera), lens and outrageous shipping charges. I knew I could trust Amazon so I cancelled the other order and received my Amazon order in a very short time period with no surprises. My only surprise was the smaller size, compared to my Canon AE-1 and the quality of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hunterpauls

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for the amateur who wants to learn more.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good pictures, and fun. I am just about to retire. I wanted a good camera but not a point and shoot. I don't manually adjust cameras but I like the SLR features. This camera is easy to use as for a non-expert photographer but it offers a lot of upside if I learn more and more about photography. I've gotten some remarkable pictures and enjoy the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Floria

customer_reviews.title: Stepped up from an Fujifilm S5000 to a Nikon D3000 DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the DSLR system of photography. The Nikon D3000 kit included a couple of DVDs from Nikon School with information about D3000 use and pointers with taking photographs. Reading the camera's manual is a must to familiarize with camera controls and settings. The included lenses are more than enough to get started along with the 8 GB memory card. I do plan on getting a second battery and a 32 GB memory card. The picture quality it produces are light years ahead of my old Fujifilm. I really like how it renders cityscape scenes at dusk among others--sharp and vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Michael777R

customer_reviews.title: Canon G9 versus Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: I just returned the D3000 because I didn't think it has as good or better picture quality as my older Canon G9. I have taken some amazing pictures with my G9 but the D3000 certainly didn't compare to it. I was really shocked because I expected a big improvement. I tried the 3000 on auto and some scene modes but the pictures didn't appear that sharp even though I braced it more than enough for a steady shot and a lot more than I need to with the G9. All of the pictures on the D3000 were taken with the kit lens 18-55 so maybe it's just not that good on scenic pictures.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I have't touched a camera in a long time and I'm new to photography. But so far it's a great camera. I love it and can't wait to use in the upcoming celebration. P.s. had great service from the buyer.
customer_reviews.author: RabJani

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: For an older model, it takes great pictures. Nice to have a viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: David Becker

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I would buy a Nikon product but not from this seller. This was either grey market or the seller knowingly sold a defective product. The shutter refuses to release and returns an error message. The lens is one of those ultra cheap pieces of plastic that loses focus and even at the best of times falls out of focus on one side.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Posey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a few years old when I bought it in December of 2011, but it still makes a great entry level DSLR. Chock full of features and comes with a small built in flash that is adequate for shots indoors and the lens is a good intermediate lens. It won't zoom too far and won't get great macro shots, but it's a nice all around lens that you won't have to change too often if you're not taking pictures at the extremes of either spectrum. Overall, very happy, Nikon won't let you down. 4/5 stars for lack of video ability.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera~
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a back up to my D7000 and my D80 ~ I use it for my personal photos mostly- it does awesome in low light situations (the no-flash option is the easiest way to take a quick, spur of the moment photo in a dark situation) and the colors are SUPER bright. I love this camera! Very easy to use too- i love how the whole screen shows you everything you need to know about the settings you have set and how much battery life is left.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Miller

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR, and I bought it planning to start up a business doing pictures for families and children. I am a nanny, so I am always taking pics of kids! Overall, the camera is great! Some of the features take some getting used to, but for the most part I just experiment with it and figure it out. It's a little boxy to carry around compared to a point-and-shoot, but not any worse than other DSLRs. And there really isn't much difference between this one and newer models, except for price! If you are looking for a good DSLR, this is the one! [...]
customer_reviews.author: D. Rude

customer_reviews.title: Professional Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking the most beautiful pictures of our granddaughters and uploading them to my picturetown and sharing them with family. I am still learning about the ins and outs of the camera as there is so much to learn. Thank goodness for the automatic features. The camera is lightweight. I do wish the camera had HD Video capability ..that's the only feature it doesn't have. This is my first digital camera, my former camera is a Nikon N50 film camera. I trust Nikon's quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Deal
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera and the additional telephoto lens is a big bonus. I've had Nikon SLR cameras since the late 60's but this is my first DSLR. I wouldn't have it any other way. The camera is easy to use in the default settings and I look forward to delving into the various 'advanced' settings. The resolution is great ... I don't have a need to make extreme enlargements. The Amazon price was by far the lowest around.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Freitas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera bundle!
customer_reviews.text: The bundle comes with everything you need to start off as an avid photographer. Camera, lens, an 8GB SD, and even some software to get you started. The Camera is very simple to use, and the program settings for Aperture, Shutter speed, are brilliant! Also the macro setting takes photos in DETAIL. I like to shoot cars, action photos, and the occasional sunset, this DSLR is perfect for it! Overall very satisfied with it, and the price is hard to beat! My ONLY con with this camera is that it does NOT take video, but oh well, with that being said, it still gets 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: TraveltheDan

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fun, and great pics
customer_reviews.text: Our old point & shoot was replaced by this kit. Great autofocus and fast shutter. After the 1-2 second delay from our old camera this is a real joy to use (especially for fidgety kids). The included lens is good for inside pics - relatively close. I recommend the 55-200mm autofocus zoom lens as a necessary accessory for outside shots (the kids play soccer). One caution, professional reviews talk about the multi-point focus providing depth of field focus for foreground and background objects. For action shots, keep your main object [kid] centered to make sure they are in focus.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abel

customer_reviews.title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS
customer_reviews.text: I haven't stopped taking pictures since I got it. I have already added a Nikon 70-300mm and I am having a blast with it. It takes really nice pictures. I did a lot of research between the D5000 and this one and there's very little difference in specs, that's why I decided to get the D3000. I've posted some of it in the web and people are already asking if I'm selling any of the pictures that I've taken. So this camera's definitely a 5 star rating for me.
customer_reviews.author: diegOdariO SnapShotS

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for moving forward in photography for keen amateurs
customer_reviews.text: A workhorse of a DSLR - it is one of the highest non-commercial cameras and is versatile for everything from auto mode to fully manual with tons of pre-set 'scene' options. This is my second - when my first was stollen I didn't even look for other models. I even use this for my semi-professional underwater photography.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm Mama

customer_reviews.title: From D40 to D3000
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera as a upgrade from my D40 and as soon as I started taking photos I noticed a big difference in the two! I love the focal points on this camera which allow for more creative shots, I also love the in-camera editing features. I needed a small DSLR because I have small hands, I thought the D3000 would be smaller then the D40 and although they feel the same in my hand the D3000 will not fit in my old D40 case. The VR lens is great as well. I'm very happy I upgraded to this camera!
customer_reviews.author: worldaroundme

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It's easy to use, right from the start, and takes great pictures. I still plan on learning lots more about SLR cameras so I can use it to its full potential, but I can definitely see the quality of my pictures has already improved. I would suggest buying a few high quality lenses to add to your pack. The ones it comes with are just alright.
customer_reviews.author: A. Osmon

customer_reviews.title: Solid DSLR but the Canon Rebel won me over
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid DSLR and was my first foray into that camera category. In the end, I returned it as I found the Canon Rebel XSi (EOS) to be a better camera. What was better? Image quality was #1, the difference isn't night and day between them but definitely noticeable. The EOS also offers the Pint and Shoot style function of letting the user utilize the LCD screen as a live view finder. Lastly, Amazon had a great special on the purchase of the zoom lens (55-250) as a package with the camera, and this made the Canon a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great photos
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR and I'm loving it. It takes great photos and with the extras this is an exceptional value. The only thing I did not realize about the camera and do not like is that you can only take pics through the viewfinder. I would highly recommend this camera for an up and coming photo buff like myself because of the ease of use and the quality of the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a photography class and it worked perfectly. I have continued to use it even after the class was done.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Love my Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes better pictures than any I have ever used. I looked very carefully at many cameras before choosing. Generally the newer cameras have 14 or 16 MP, but I found that this was more than I needed and sometimes made an image more fuzzy than the 10.2 MP on this camera. Uploading to my computer is a breeze. The display is a good size and allows me to select which images I want to upload and delete easily the ones I don't want to keep. I really wanted a DSLR camera and this one is just perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Edietiqs

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is fairly easy to use, I have never even read the manual for it. It has a great range of feature and pretty good picture quality. Its a pretty small camera and its nice and easy to carry. I love the huge display screen that makes it really easy to look at picture. Its fun to use and has a great range of settings to allow to go from almost all automatic making shots quick and easy to set up and take, to fully manual.
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: great for pictures
customer_reviews.text: first dslr. great for family events and picture taking for those who do not need the high end dslrs but need something better that point and shoots. the vr lens work great and worth the extra money. the 3 frames per second is great for the novice user for sporting events. not having live view is not a big of a deal as it seems. the viewfinder works just as well. great value for the package.
customer_reviews.author: bang for your buck

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect SLR camera for home use. Easy to use, But takes pictures on par if not better than other more complicated cameras. I bought this camera for my wife becuse there is a menu option that walks you through all the different settings. We had another more expensive SLR that we bought a few years ago. That camera was higher end and too complicated for a family camera. Everybody that picks this one up can take great pictures right from the start.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, great bundle value
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera and I really love it. I feel that this bundle package with the extra lenses was a great price for everything you need to start with this type of camera. I am taking a photography class to learn about all the functions and how to manually change settings to get better pictures. I find that all the pictures I take are great quality and really crisp, especially compared to my old basic point and shoot. I would definately recommend this camera as a user friendly, perfect package for someone wanting to start with a dslr, there are definitely plenty of functions and settings to learn and play with without being entirely overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a starter photographer and like to buy an DSLR... I've searched about DSLR's reviews and likes the Nikon comments... I've selected the D3000 because the relation price/value was great. The D3000 produces great images and this kit it's greater. Becomes with Nikon travel bag, a 8GB SD Memory Card, 2 Nikon School videos, Camera and the 18-55 & 55-200 lens... Pros: Good photos if you like photo only DSLR... If you want recording video consider to buy an D3100 or better... With this camera can't rec video...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Medina

customer_reviews.title: A long-term fan of the Nikon line
customer_reviews.text: I have never found the Nikon line to be lacking, even at times when I was unable to afford their prices. As an experienced amateur photographer for many years, I consider the camera easy to learn and use, comfortable to the hand and eye, of high quality throughout and rugged enough for tough field work.
customer_reviews.author: carl brookins

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this a christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great STARTER/Family camera, I would not offer this to a pro, But for the average family like ours this is a great camera. The con's is what you get with this, A great package, The Camera it self takes fantastic photo's and comes with 2 lenses. The main dis advantage is that it does NOT do video!
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONman1290

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived today, and I put aside other things to open it. Wow! It was packaged so nicely with a very nice knapsack. The camera was in good condition (I had to supply a camera card, but that's not much). The young lady I ordered this for I think is really going to like it.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Brenneman

customer_reviews.title: Finally got one at a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: For years have been wanting to get a DSLR, opportunity came knocking and I jumped on it fast. Although it lacks some fancy bells and whistles, it has all the major basic needs for a photo enthusiast. Sweet style, functions, and the few pics I've taken are spectacular. Its a great beginning model, and came with many nice extras.
customer_reviews.author: Boone52

customer_reviews.title: This wasn't what I originally ordered. Not sure what happened there ,but the item I received my daughter loved
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera, Bought it for my daughter for Xmas, she's had ample time to learn how to use it now, and she totally loves it, so I am not at all disappointed that the item I ordered isn't actually the item I received. We had a little dispute initially that didn't sit well with me, but all's well that ends well as they say.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie J. Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera same images as d4
customer_reviews.text: Still a great camera as of 2016. I have taken some of the most awesome travel images with this one and the 3200. When I don't want to have a d600 hanging around my neck all day/have fun, I love these small gems.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera, however, you can only see your subjects through the view finder and not the LED screen like I am accustomed to doing with my other camera's. Nikon told me it was not equipped to be able to use the LED screen to view your subjects. If I had known this, I would have upgraded to another camera.
customer_reviews.author: rhonda leonard

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with DSLR quality and zoom lines
customer_reviews.text: This bundle included a zoom lens and regular lens. The picture quality is fantastic. I have never had a DSLR before. We were hoping it would take baby pictures very quickly, but if flash is needed there is a delay. In daylight it takes pictures almost instantly. I am very happy we could get a DSLR with two lenses for $400.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Karbon

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took it in with us on our cruise and got some fantastic pictures! I was overwelmed by all the different functions on the camera at first, but the more you review the functions and start using the camera it all starts sinking in and is easy to use. Very happy with whow it works and the pictures I have gotten so far.
customer_reviews.author: KAO

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable SLR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I am a blogger and needed better quality pics. I had wanted the Canon Rebel but couldn't afford it, so I went with this. I was IMMEDIATELY impressed. The pictures look great -- so crisp and clear, like a magazine. I haven't bought any additional lenses, which I am sure would improve the quality even more, but I am really, really happy with what I got for the money. It was $300 less than the camera I thought I needed and takes really quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Gave this camera as a gift and she just loves it! Teriffic entry level DSLR and to see if photography is something a person would want to pursue as a serious hobby. Only drawback being that this camera does not have video capability. Multi-shot funciton is nice and smooth, takes great pictures and has a wide variety of picture modes and capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck-W

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was my very first DSLR camera and it rocks! It's easy to use and capable of capturing some beautiful images. I highly recommend this product, especially to digital photography beginners. The DVDs included in this bundle are wonderfully helpful. Plus, it comes with a second lens!
customer_reviews.author: macyonethirty

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for newbees
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera for freshmen. I'm still learning to use it. It may need more than 1 year time's to get familiar with every function and setting of it, if you don't take lots of time on really learning it, but just take photo shot radomly. The camera is also very well manufactured. Very good quality!!! and also very comfortable while holding it. It's too much better than my friend's D60 and Canon's entry level SLR. For the lens, I don't think I really need to buy a 55-200 for it. Maybe I will buy a better camera with the lens of 18-200 together several years' later. Right now, this is enough for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little uneasy about the cost of the Nikon D3000 at first, but the quality of the pictures and its overall functionality (for an older model) was woth the investment. I absolutely love this camera! Very user friendly and great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: cckbella

customer_reviews.title: Great product..
customer_reviews.text: Well so far so good. It has made us happy. Much better than what we had before. Only thing is the case is a waste. Does not fit every thing nice and neat. We will be getting another one. I saw this exact bag at Target for about 50 bucks. Not worth it at all. Not every secure either. Other than that its been great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3000 review
customer_reviews.text: Have had this camera a week and its alot of fun! Way better than the little point and shoot digi.cameras. Have owned afew 35mm slr's,but this is my first dslr and i gotta say it is very user friendly. As i get to know my way around its functions,new ideas keep driving me to experiment with the camera. This Nikon is a great way to get introduced to digital photography.
customer_reviews.author: StoneAge

customer_reviews.title: Bundle Bundle Bundle
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect bundle for the photography beginner! I got this because I needed the dslr for some of my classes (in art school) and it literally came with everything I could possibly need for a beginner! I'm so happy with this buy just because it was such a good deal, most cameras surpass this price and I got so much more!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: For the money and ease of use, great camera for the beginner!
customer_reviews.text: My wife & I treated ourselves to this camera as gift to each other. We are novices but read other reviews and checked other sites and we are happy with our choice. Plus with DVD we were able to get started and shoot nice pictures right away. I feel the assistance you get with the menu and help screens make it such that you can find most of your answers right away on the camera. One thing to consider is to purchase the 2 lens kit as immediately it became apparent to us we needed the 200mm lens. We could have saved a few dollars by buying the kit with both lenses and the DVDs come with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: RE Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera when paired with extras
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. It is easy to use and the picture quality is very good. Considering the price that you pay for this camera with a few basic additions like extra lenses and different filters, this camera is amazing. Highly recommend to anyone with an interest in photography, even if its just a few pictures a year this camera is worth it. I would like to see an option for controlling shutter speed but that is a very minor inconvenience that can be worked around.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Great camera kit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The kit price for this camera with two lenses was the best I could find anywhere. This DSLR camera is just what I wanted - I didn't care that it does not have video capability (I wanted a still picture camera). I also wanted a larger display screen (3" as opposed to Canon 2.75") and don't use the display as a viewfinder anyway - I wanted through the lens viewing to set up my photo shoots.It was a bonus to have the tripod and remote control for flash photos included in the bundle. I would have preferred to have the VR lenses, but for the price I paid, the supplied lenses are fine.
customer_reviews.author: NJT

customer_reviews.title: Value Buy
customer_reviews.text: The introduction of the new D3100 is pushing the older D3000 prices down, this D3000 is becoming a value buy. The new D3100 only offers one additional ISO setting, up to ISO 6400, while D3000 still can go up to ISO 3200 with Hi-1 setting, which is more than enough for my photography needs. Very easy to learn to use. Photo images are very sharp, can't beat Nikon quality. I also like the feature of self cleansing sensor everytime I switch off the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ho

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money you wont be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: The D3000 is a camera that will carry you from beginner to advanced photography. The price on Amazon was the best and it was here in a flash. After using a Nikon 35mm for the past 25 years this is Heaven. You cant go wrong with this one in this price range. If you are going to spend within $100,s of the price for a lesser camera, spend a $100,s more for this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. hewitt

customer_reviews.title: DSLR Finally
customer_reviews.text: This camera is my first venture into DSLR, but not my first Nikon. Nikon 4004 film camera that was extensively used before the digital age. The D3000 camera is lighter than expected and easy to handle. It is not point and shoot, although it can be, allowing greater flexibility for photo composition. The picture quality and speed are exceptional, and expected from a Nikon. For the price, for individuals getting back into SLR (or DSLR) photography, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Glasheen

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile slr
customer_reviews.text: Got it with rebate and no problem. Product is as mentioned in many reviews. For first time ale you cannot go wrong. Used in Mexico. Us Honduras panama. Light enough to carry. I use a Targums sling back pack that is great to carry all gear and then some withou being in the way
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Great Start
customer_reviews.text: This is a definitely great start for anyone who wants to get into photography as a profession or as a hobby. Great camera. I fell in love from the first day. It feels great in my hand, very well built. The image quality is AMAZING. This is by far superior than Canon for the same price. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: volodoscope

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this camera. Great close up, great portraits, great up close nighttime shots. You need a big flash for nighttime shots though if you are farther away. I get a real crisp photo with this camera. People have really been impressed with the photos I send to them.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerChampion

customer_reviews.title: Nikon d3000
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera during Christmas for my wife. She wanted a camera to get into photography as a hobby. So far she has absolutely loved this camera. It has been easy to operate and takes great pictures. There is also something about holding this style of camera in your hands that makes one feel hip and cool. Buy it, you'll enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: E. RICHARDS

customer_reviews.title: A great beginner camera
customer_reviews.text: Still my current camera until I upgrade! Easy to maneuver and figure out, perfect for someone starting out in photography!
customer_reviews.author: liztakesphotos

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Nikon camera bundle to replace another camera that quit. The package was offered at what I considered a fair price. I am pleased with the quality of the product and the results I have had to date. I am no camera expert and just use it for family events and trips.
customer_reviews.author: CBH

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera when it works, the auto zoom stops working intermittently. I sent it top Nikon and they didn't find any issues and now it's out of warranty... Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: BudmanTom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for beginning experts
customer_reviews.text: After using my cell phone camera for every occasion, I've wanted a decent camera for years. I was debating whether to get this or an automatic, pocket-sized digital and I finally went ahead and bought this one after a few months of research. I've had it for about a month now and could not be happier. I'm seriously an amateur, I have no experience. But with the Guide Mode on this camera, I am taking quality pictures and learning about photography in the process. This is the first product I felt compelled to review because I was so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Porter

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: The purchased product arrived exactly as described, and even better!! I could not be happier with my order. Great price and great product. No wear and tear or even the slightest notice of any use. Seller was very accessible, friendly, and quickly responded to any questions I had. I would certainly recommend this seller to others and would be very happy to purchase more items from him in the future!! Thanks for an awesome experience!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: D3000
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera but wish I had waited a few more months for the D3100. I have no regrets and love using this camera in the mountains, at the beach, and during holiday parties. I've taken some really great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen B.

customer_reviews.title: First time DSLR user
customer_reviews.text: I dont have much to say here because I dont know that much about DSLR. The reason I got one is I wanted to upgrade from point and shoots and I can never be more satisfied. The pictures were great and I feel like a pro. I cant believe how small it is though and it's very light to carry. I just love my Nikon D3000. Thank you for making this affordable. It was such a great deal especially for first-time DSLR user like me.
customer_reviews.author: MsPinkle

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I had been using point and shoot and digital cameras for the past 10 years and was disappointed with the quality and delay when pressing the shutter button. Although the the Nikon D3000 is an entry level camera, it takes professional looking photographs. The images are beautiful. The guide on the camera is very useful, and the camera is easy to use. It is also light for an SLR. The viewing screen is a nice size and you can zoom. I would recommend this camera to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Gordon

customer_reviews.title: my first DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR so i cant give a comparison but i can say that anyone interested in creating photographs that would last a life time should invest in one! And considering the low price of entry level models, its not a huge jump from some of the traditional point and shoots out there. MY experience so far has been amazing! The camera itself is, i think, perfect for a newbie in the DSLR world as it literally guides you through complicated pictures. Other than that the auto mode will get you amazing results on its own. I am beginning to explore it now and am sure that it'll keep getting better.
customer_reviews.author: Jahanzeb Azim

customer_reviews.title: Review for Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: The nikon D3000 is a great buy for someone new so DSLR photography, or someone looking to buy a cheap DSLR camera. I've had is for a couple months and love it. I found it had a little more features then was actually adverted, one example is that it has image overlay, which is fun to play with. It has great photo quality. And is really easy to use. It's pretty compact to. The lens it comes with is one of the most basic of the Nikkor lenses but it is a good one. Altogether it's a great camera, and i would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: danv

customer_reviews.title: All I expected
customer_reviews.text: High quality, well worth the price. The case, as anticipated, is crap, but I simply use the one that I already had. Haven't tried the video. Amazon, please be careful with the packaging, it wasn't great for this shipment, though nothing was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: dsees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Beginners to DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Though the D3100 is out with more features, D3000 remains a great camera as party of the Nikon DSLR family. I actually did not need to use the Guide Modes because I had already read a TON on aperture, shutter settings, ISO, etc. Although it does get noisy by the time it gets to ISO 800, I actually used that setting in an extremely low-light setting at a karaoke to give it a retro effect. I also had a fast lens on me, so that helped. I won't say much else, because it's all been covered in the other reviews, but again, this is a great camera for beginners to get started at a low-price (relatively).
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: this is the best camera great quality great lenses lens great price would buy it again for my youngest daughter, S.I.N.Y.LADYRIDER
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.FilomeanaParesiBealePark

customer_reviews.title: Great Experience
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Nikon D3000 for my teenage daughter, who is an avid photographer. She loves the camera and it does everything she requires from it. It is a great entry level DSLR and the experience purchasing from Amazon was a delightful one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie to the DSLR world and, being a technie, I researched the heck out of the cameras available at a beginner level for someone with a limited budget. The D3000 was the standout from all the cameras I looked at. Now that I have it and have used it, I must say it delivers! The colors are vibrant, detail is crisp, and the camera is so easy to use. Only thing missing is the ability to shoot videos, but if you really want/need that, you can get the D5000. If you are looking for a nice camera that won't break your bank, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Long

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this camera for a few days. But I have used it for two different events. I don't understand all the features yet. But, it has been easy to use out of the box. I plan to watch the videos that came with the camera to learn what all it can do. This is an entry level SLR. For the money, I couldn't resist stepping up to this from a point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Way better than my point and shoot... Nikon got it again with this one
customer_reviews.text: All of the previous review have got it spot on and could not agree more, so I will not write another. I have this for my vacation and a wedding. It is just loads of fun and not intimidating to use( being from a point-and-shoot) with the Guide mode. The kit lens is great but have its limited reach so i bought the 55-200mm VR to compliment it. During the wedding, i manage to get 2 of my cousins to switch from point-and-shoot as they were impress with the D3000 with its ease of use and quality of the pictures. I already out grew my camera bag as i add the 55-200mm and a 50mm prime in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Mico Lector

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a month and have already taken about 900 pictures with it. It's a really great camera and fun to use. This was an especially good deal as the extra lens costs over $200 alone.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna F.

customer_reviews.title: i take pics
customer_reviews.text: great set up, havent needed to buy any attachments so far. only a photography hobbyist but this camera packs a pretty huge punch for the price. not to mention if you are planning on getting more serious you can invest your money in lenses NOW and then get a more expensive DSLR later.
customer_reviews.author: Donn Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value & GREAT Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to upgrade from simple point & shoot to get DSLR quality; D3000 delivers! Amazon price of $459 was great value; picture quality is outstanding. Even for an amateur, the camera is very forgiving; can easily picked up & used by anyone. The AUTO mode makes it extremely easy to use and get the photo you want. I also bought a Speedlight 600 to go with the D3000; the flash helps to create GREAT lighting and wonderful family photos. For the price, you can't beat the simplicity and quality of the D3000.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Best camera ever!!! it's Nikon, all I can say!!! and the prize...too low for the incredible quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chinex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love this camera! I baught it a few years ago and STILL use it to this day. I plan on getting the step up from to shoot video.
customer_reviews.author: G3wizz

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for an amateur photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I love photography (so much so, that I have a camera tattoo) with that being said, I am an amateur photographer and this camera has been great for my first camera! I've had it for close to 2 years now and it's perfect. I'm so glad I decided on this SLR, wouldn't have it any other way!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: hr1$
customer_reviews.text: Really haven't had this long enough to rate, but the wife loves this as a backup camera and her pictures using several lenses have been great. There are cameras out there with more bells and whistles, but this is an great basic camera to learn on or have as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: hr1$

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for an outstanding price!
customer_reviews.text: I've look for a long time and made several comparisons but this camera was by far the best camera with the absolutely best price! By the way...I received the camera in two days!
customer_reviews.author: Big man

customer_reviews.title: charger didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The charger that came with the camera never work. The camera itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nicon Camera
customer_reviews.text: Major Trouble with electronics in camera, needs to be sent out for repair
customer_reviews.author: DK in Maineville Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Love IT!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I had the D40 and I wanted something similar to it. This is just what I was looking for! I have the Olympus Pen and that was just a bit too high tech for me. I just wanted a basic DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: bOOtObessed

customer_reviews.title: Grreat camera
customer_reviews.text: after using the small pocket size digital cameras for a while I had forgot how good it is to be able to adjust the camera instead of it deciding what looked best. although with the Auto feature a child can take pictures with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: 60Nova

customer_reviews.title: New camera for future wife as wedding gift
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I literally just ordered a new camera bundle on Friday and already received it by Tuesday! Thank you for the quick delivery!! Everything I wanted was delivered with the bundle. As far as how the camera works, I will let you know! This is a gift for my fiance (future wife), as a wedding gift. She really wanted a nice camera for our honeymoon to Mexico. I look forward in taking some amazing shots! I will be in touch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kubacki

customer_reviews.title: Nikon d3000
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great! I do not use this for video so it is the d3000 was right for me. Camera takes great pictures, Battery life is very good so far. It works well on on auto. Read the manual to do the other settings. They are straight forward and to the point. If you have used a regular SLR they will make sense. I would suggest a fast sd card I have one and have not experienced the lag others have complained about. It is a great purchase for what I have used it for so far. The price was great so I did not upgrade to a 3100 or 5000. hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: chad1073

customer_reviews.title: nikon D300 digital camera
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old wanted this camera for Christmas...similar to one her friend has. She was immediately able to take pictures and figure things out and rarely turned to instructions. This is very hands-on and user friendly. It was an exceptional value as I am very much a comparison shopper and got my BEST deal here.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene J Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with my purchase. The camera is working beautifully. The addition of the extra lens really adds to the versatility of the camera. I've owned Nikons in the past (the first was a 1970 FTn) and one thing I appreciate with this camera is how light it is. My transaction with Amazon was as always perfect. Especially like the simplicity and value of Prime- well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Y.

customer_reviews.title: Grand
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It does take some getting use to. As I learn how to make my way around menus and such, it seems like they could have made it a bit more user friendly, but the camera takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Whatlight

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Bought for daughter in high school. Produces excellent quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Paul West

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery and great value. Highly recommend this camera. Good blend of price and features makes this a good value. My daughter (it was a gift) started using it immediately and thinks the photographs are terrific, especially the fast sports mode. She calls it her "flipbook" mode.
customer_reviews.author: RLBodine

customer_reviews.title: My Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: My New Nikon D3000 DSLR is great! I must confess though, I am a newbie to Digital Photography. I have have been using the Nikon D3000 for two weeks. I have been taking pictures using the automatic Modes on the Nikon D3000. These Auto Modes make it easy for someone like me to take clear and bright pictures. I'm looking forward to learning the other Manual Modes so I may continue taking better photographs in the future. Thank you Amazon for your Online Recomendations for the great and easy to use Nikon D3000 Digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: There is so much information on the CD to help me learn about the camera. There is also a lot of visual information right on the camera screen to guide me through the menus.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: just love it
customer_reviews.text: it's a great beginer camera, i took a lot of pics with my d3000, and they a excelent photos. In the future i'll buy another nikon drsl camera...
customer_reviews.author: jesus montaner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this camera! Took action shots this weekend at a majorette competition and captured batons in the air with very little blur! I'm still learning all the features, but am extremely pleased with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Schweigert

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D3000
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner camera for my daughter. The camera works Great
customer_reviews.author: D. Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera sooner than I expected. Make sure that you read ALL the instructions, and watch the videos before you go shoot- Ths is important. Nice Nikkon Lenses
customer_reviews.author: fantastic

product_meta.title: Nikon D3000 10.2MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingBreathtaking digital SLR image quality and easy operation highlight the 10.2-megapixel D3000--Nikon's friendliest DSLR ever. Compact and capable, the D3000 is compatible with a broad range of world-famous Nikkor lenses and includes the versatile 3x, 18-55mm Zoom-Nikkor with Silent-Wave Motor autofocusing and Nikon VR image stabilization to combat picture blur caused by camera shake for sharper handheld pictures. Special moments are captured faithfully at up to 3 frames-per-second and displayed on a bright, 3-inch LCD monitor. The D3000's split-second shutter response eliminates the annoyance of shutter lag. To further simplify picture-taking in special situations such as portraits, sports, landscapes, and more, the D3000 features icon-identified Scene Modes that deliver beautiful results automatically in otherwise complex situations.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Breathtaking digital SLR image quality and easy operation highlight the 10.2-megapixel D3000--Nikon's friendliest DSLR ever. Compact and capable, the D3000 is compatible with a broad range of world-famous Nikkor lenses and includes the versatile 3x, 18-55mm Zoom-Nikkor with Silent-Wave Motor autofocusing and Nikon VR image stabilization to combat picture blur caused by camera shake for sharper handheld pictures. Special moments are captured faithfully at up to 3 frames-per-second and displayed on a bright, 3-inch LCD monitor. The D3000's split-second shutter response eliminates the annoyance of shutter lag. To further simplify picture-taking in special situations such as portraits, sports, landscapes, and more, the D3000 features icon-identified Scene Modes that deliver beautiful results automatically in otherwise complex situations. Additional Nikon technologies elevate picture quality and guard against picture-taking mistakes. Fast, accurate 11-point autofocus delivers razor sharpness. 3D Color Matrix Metering II and Nikon EXPEED image processing work with an exclusive Scene Recognition System for precise automatic exposures and rich, vivid color. Making the D3000 an even smarter choice are its exclusive Re-touch functions for creative fun and the onboard Guide Mode that's ready to lend a reassuring hand to take the pictures you've always wanted. 



Nikon D3000 Highlights 

10.2-megapixel DX-format Imaging Sensor
Delivers extraordinary image quality for breathtaking prints up to 20 x 30 inches. 

Includes 3x 18-55mm Zoom-Nikkor VR Image Stabilization Lens
Legendary Nikkor optical quality and fast, accurate autofocus means vivid color, striking contrast and crisp detail, while VR image stabilization assures your sharpest pictures ever. 

Compact Design
Beautifully styled--Ready to go where life takes you. 

Easy-To-Use--Featuring Nikon Guide Mode
Intuitive controls and the on-board Guide Mode assist you every step of the way. 

Split-second Shutter Response
Eliminates the frustration of shutter delay, capturing moments that other cameras miss. 

Continuous Shooting up to 3 Frames-Per-Second
Capture fast action, precious moments and fleeting expressions confidently. 

6 Automatic Exposure Scene Modes
Just set the Mode dial to Portrait, Landscape, Child, Sports, Close-up or Night Portrait for stunning results in otherwise challenging conditions. 

3-inch Color LCD Monitor
Bright, high-resolution, 170-degree wide-angle viewing for easy picture review and sharing. 

In-camera Image Editing
The Retouch Menu provides creative freedom, without the need for a computer, offering 13 easy editing functions, including Trim, Red-eye Correction and Soft Filter. 

Nikon EXPEED Image Processing
Assures breathtakingly rich image quality, managing color, contrast, exposure, noise and speed. 

Automatic Image Sensor Cleaning
Ultrasonic process and exclusive Airflow Control combats the accumulation of dust in front of the image sensor, safeguarding image quality shot after shot. 

11-point Autofocus
Fast and accurate autofocus delivers razor-sharp pictures. 

6 Personal Picture Control Settings
Choose from Standard, Neutral, Vivid, Monochrome, Portrait, or Landscape to apply a personal look and feel to your pictures. 

Active D-Lighting
Restores picture-enhancing detail in shadows and highlights. 

ISO sensitivity from 100-1600
Exceptional results, even in challenging low-light situations. 

What's in the Box  * 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens 
 * Rechargeable Li-ion Battery 
 * Quick Charger 
 * Eyepiece Cap 
 * Rubber Eyecup 
 * USB Cable 
 * Camera Strap 
 * Body Cap 
 * Accessory Shoe Cover 
 * Software Suite CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 10.2-megapixel DX-format imaging sensor for prints up to 20 x 30 inches
Includes 3x 18-55mm Zoom-Nikkor VR Image Stabilization lens
Nikon EXPEED image processing; in-camera image editing and Active D-Lighting
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars561 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
